questions.text: Correct sequence after p wave: A- 'a' wave B- 1st heart sound C- Rapid filling of ventricles D- 't' wave
Where in the tubule would a patient with severe central diabetes insipidus have the lowest tubular fluid osmolality?

Identify the true statements The major source of plasma von Willebrand factor (vWF) is endothelial cells. Rees and Ecker's solution is used as a diluting fluid in the RBC pipette for performing platelet counts. Caspase 9 binds to Cyt-c and APAF-1 complex. Liquid paraffin is the most commonly used fixation technique for preserving fat in histopathological sections.

A 25-year-old male patient was started on a cephalosporin for enteric fever. After a few days of therapy, the patient develops easy bruisability and lab work shows elevated PT and aPTT. Which of the following cephalosporins was administered?
Which of the following are reduced in Iron Deficiency Anemia ? Ferritin TIBC Transferrin saturation RDW Hepcidin Soluble transferrin receptor
A researcher discovered a mutation that disrupts the enzyme transpeptidase. Which antibiotic does this mutation confer resistance to?
Which of the following markers will be positive in the following patient?

A 65-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after developing sudden-onset right-side weakness and difficulty speaking. He has a history of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation and has been taking warfarin for the past several years with a stable prothrombin time. His wife adds that he started taking a new drug 2 weeks ago, but she does not remember its name. Transesophageal echocardiogram reveals a small thrombus in the left atrium. This patient most likely started taking which of the following drugs recently?

Identify the correct statements Macula densa is located at the Junction of thick ascending limb and DCT The organ with the least arteriovenous pressure difference is the kidney. Massive splenomegaly is noted in hairy cell leukaemia, CML and aplastic anemia Lipofuschin is intranuclear, peri-lysosomal in location.

A 50-year-old man on treatment for adenocarcinoma lung presents with complaints of facial puffiness and frothy urine. Given below is the histological image of the condition. Where will the deposits be seen?
Which cyclin-CDK (cyclin-dependent kinase) combination is essential for the G2 to M phase transition of cell cycle?

Which of the following statements is true about proto-oncogenes? KIT has increased expression in GIST. KRAS mutation is more commonly associated with small-cell lung carcinoma. ERBB2 over-expression is associated with breast carcinomas. PDGFR-β has suppressed expression in colorectal cancers.
Regarding the procedure done with the needle shown below, which of the following is false?

options.label: C
options.text: The bevel should face upwards while inserting the needle.

questions.correct_answer: D. Coagulopathy is not a contraindication.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Coagulopathy is not a contraindication

questions.text: Counter current mechanism is found in: Eye Testis Gut Kidney Lungs

options.label: D
options.text: ii, iii, iv, v are correct

questions.correct_answer: D. ii, iii, iv, v are correct
questions.explanation: Ans. D) ii, iii, iv, v are correct

questions.text: A 17-year-old boy presents with sudden-onset palpitations and lightheadedness while playing video games. He states this has occurred intermittently over the past year, but the episodes typically resolve spontaneously after a few minutes. He denies chest pain, shortness of breath, or syncope. ECG is shown below. Which of the following abnormalities is most likely present in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Accessory pathway bypassing the AV node

options.label: B
options.text: Degeneration of the atrioventricular conduction system

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman presents to the clinic with complaints of weight loss, heat intolerance, palpitations, and insomnia over the past 4 months. Her vital signs are blood pressure 140/85 mm Hg, pulse 110/min, and regular. On examination, the thyroid gland is diffusely enlarged and non-tender. Laboratory studies reveal decreased serum TSH and elevated free thyroxine (T4) levels. Methimazole is initiated as treatment. Which of the following processes is most likely inhibited by this treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Iodide uptake by the thyroid gland

options.label: C
options.text: Peripheral conversion of T4 to T3

questions.text: You work under a research scientist who is working on determining the association of adenocarcinoma of pancreas with a compound X. He uses a test whose steps are shown in the image below to determine the mutagenic effect and potential carcinogenicity of compound X. What is this test that he has used?

Many GPCR receptors act via an increase in cAMP. The steps involved in this mechanism are given below. Which of the following is the correct sequence of events in the cAMP signal transduction pathway? Activation of adenylate cyclase Activation of PKA Conversion of ATP to cAMP Phosphorylation of target proteins
The flow volume curve after spirometry in patient 1 is given below. The most likely diagnosis in this patient is:
Which of the following proteins connects the lines marked in the following image?

A 71-year-old man has had decreased urine output of <500 mL per day for the past 3 days. Physical examination shows vital signs with temperature 37°C, pulse 88/min, respiratory rate 18/min, and blood pressure 85/60 mmHg. Urinalysis shows specific gravity of 1.019 and no protein, blood, glucose, ketones, WBCs, RBCs, or casts. His serum creatinine is 3 mg/dL, and urea nitrogen is 62 mg/dL. The fractional excretion of sodium (FENa) is <1%. Which of the following underlying conditions is he most likely to have?
Identify the drug pharmacokinetics from the graph:

options.label: D
options.text: Cannot be determined from the image

questions.text: Identify the correct statements Cephalosporins that require dose adjustment in renal failure are ceftriaxone and cefoperazone. Aminophylline acts as an adenosine receptor antagonist leading to diuresis An orphan drug is a drug that is required for treatment or prevention of a rare disease Esmolol can prolong the AP duration leading to torsade’s de pointes.

A 45-year-old male patient came to the physician due with generalized painless lymphadenopathy. On immunohistochemistry, cells expressed are CD5, CD20, and cyclin D1. Which translocation is responsible for this patient's pathology?
A patient presents with left-sided facial paralysis and weakness for the past 1 hour. Her blood pressure is 160/100 mmHg and CT is shown below. What would be your next step?
Which of the following conditions has the same underlying pathophysiology as the mechanism of action of Eptifibatide?
Match the following with types of hypersensitivity:
All of the following are criteria for diagnosis of DKA except:

Two weeks after undergoing allogeneic stem cell transplant for multiple myeloma, a 55-year-old man develops a severely pruritic rash, abdominal cramps, and profuse diarrhea. He appears lethargic. Physical examination shows yellow sclerae. There is a generalized maculopapular rash on his face, trunk, and lower extremities, and desquamation of both soles. His serum alanine aminotransferase is 115 U/L, serum aspartate aminotransferase is 97 U/L, and serum total bilirubin is 2.7 mg/dL. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Donor T cells in the graft

questions.correct_answer: A. Donor T cells in the graft
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Donor T cells in the graft

questions.text: A 41-year-old male patient presented with a sudden onset of severe headache and vomiting. On examination, marked neck rigidity was noted. LP was done which reveals findings as shown in the image. Which among the following drugs is ideal for preventing delayed cerebral ischemia in this patient?

A 15-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department due to confusion, abdominal pain, and vomiting for the past two days. Her parents report that she has been excessively thirsty and urinating frequently over the last few weeks. On examination, her vital signs are as follows: temperature 37.2°C (99°F), pulse 110/min, blood pressure 90/60 mm Hg, and respiratory rate 28/min. Laboratory investigations reveal the following: Glucose 320 mg/dL Sodium 132 meq/l Potassium 5.2 meq/l Bicarbonate 12 meq/l Arterial pH 7.25 Urinalysis: Positive for urine and ketones Which of the following factors most likely contributed to the development of this patient's condition?
The image below demonstrates normal lung volumes and capacities. Which of the following changes is unlikely in a “pink puffer”?
Casoni reaction is seen in patients with hydatid cyst. Which of the following is incorrect about the immunoglobulin causing this reaction?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the only heat stable antibody

options.label: B
options.text: Levels are raised in helminthic infections

options.label: C
options.text: It does not pass the placental barrier

options.label: D
options.text: It has a half-life of 1-5 days

questions.correct_answer: A. It is the only heat stable antibody
questions.explanation: Ans. A) It is the only heat stable antibody

questions.text: Identify the correct statements: In nutmeg liver, dark areas represent necrosis due to passive congestion, and white areas represent viable liver tissue. Sirtuins are a family of seven histone deacetylases involved in increasing insulin sensitivity. Long-term hemodialysis patients with renal failure lead to development of amyloidosis due to the accumulation of Aβ2-microglobulin. Factor V Leiden mutation is the most common inherited cause of hypercoagulability.
A 45-year-old female patient has NYHA class III heart failure, with dyspnea, pedal edema and K+ levels of 5.5mg% and creatinine 1.1 mg%. Which of the following drugs can be used in this patient?

A 28-year-old medical student undergoes a tuberculin skin test (TST) as part of a routine health check. He is asymptomatic with no history of recent fever, weight loss, or cough. He receives an intradermal injection of purified protein derivative (PPD) on the inner surface of his forearm. After 48 hours, a raised, erythematous induration measuring 18 mm is observed at the injection site. Which of the following interactions is critical to the development of this patient’s skin reaction?

options.label: A
options.text: CD14 on macrophages with bacterial lipopolysaccharide

options.label: B
options.text: CD16 on NK cells with IgG-coated infected cells

options.label: C
options.text: CD18 on neutrophils with ICAM-1 on endothelial cells

options.label: D
options.text: CD28 on T lymphocytes with CD80/86 on epidermal dendritic cells

questions.correct_answer: D. CD28 on T lymphocytes with CD80/86 on epidermal dendritic cells
questions.explanation: Ans. D) CD28 on T lymphocytes with CD80/86 on epidermal dendritic cells

questions.text: A 35 year old male presented with rapidly progressing, symmetrical muscle weakness, starting in the legs. Which of the following is not a treatment option in this patient?

A 7-year-old boy is brought to the clinic for history of multiple episodes of acute bony pain as well as sudden transient chest pain. Peripheral blood smear with Wright stain is shown. This patient's PBS are most likely related to which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Inability to produce beta globin chains

options.label: D
options.text: Persistence of red blood cell precursor nuclei

questions.correct_answer: D. Persistence of red blood cell precursor nuclei
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Persistence of red blood cell precursor nuclei

questions.text: A 31-year-old woman comes to the AIIMS OPD due to a 6.8-kg weight gain over the last few months. The patient also has experienced weakness and cannot lift weights that she was able to lift before the onset of her symptoms. On examination, blood pressure is 160/100 mmHg and pulse is 88/min and regular. Neurologic examination shows proximal muscle weakness. Dark terminal hair is present on the lower abdomen. Fasting laboratory results are as follows: Sodium-142 mEq/L Potassium-3.6 mEq/L Chloride-98 mEq/L Bicarbonate-28 mEq/L Calcium-9.2 mg/dL TSH-2.2 mlU/L (N-0.5 to 5.0 mIU/L) Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in evaluating this patient's condition?
questions.correct_answer: B. Overnight low-dose dexamethasone suppression test
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Overnight low-dose dexamethasone suppression test

questions.text: Which of the following is not a component of Syndrome Z in a 45-year old Indian man?

A 3-year-old boy presents with recurrent bacterial infections and Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia. The flowcytometry analysis of the boy (Boxes c & d) is shown below (Boxes a & b are normal). What is the most likely diagnosis?
All of the following are the part of the innate immunity except:
All of the factors would suggest a higher risk for a patient with TIA developing stroke in the future according to ABCD2 scoring except:
Identify the malignancy:
A 25-year-old woman presents with asymmetric sensory loss in the right leg and skin lesions as shown below. Lab evaluation reveals eosinophilia. What is the likely diagnosis?

Arrange the following sentences in the correct order for activation of B cells. T-helper cells interact with the presented antigen peptides. Improved quality of the immune response with affinity maturation. Somatic hypermutation and immunoglobulin isotype class switching occur. Antigen binding to B cell receptor. Binding of CD40 ligand on T cells to CD 40 on B cells.
A patient presents with vertigo, diplopia, hoarseness, dysphagia and left Horner's syndrome associated with numbness of the left face and right-side limbs. Which artery is affected in this patient?
Which of the following is not a major diagnostic criterion of neuromyelitis Optica?
What characteristics define necrosis among the options provided? Disrupted cell membrane Induces inflammation Swelling of the cell Can be seen physiologically Causes nuclear fragmentation
All of the following are the correct statements about Blood transfusion except:

options.label: A
options.text: Blood received from blood bank should be completely transfused within 4 hours of receiving

options.label: B
options.text: Calcium can be added to the blood product to prevent hypocalcemia

options.label: D
options.text: Acute hemolytic transfusion reaction may present in first 24hrs

questions.correct_answer: B. Calcium can be added to the blood product to prevent hypocalcemia

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy has frequent episodes of facial edema around his lips. It usually occurs after an emotional stressor. He also has a family history of similar conditions. Which of the following is the main mediator of these symptoms?
Which of the following is responsible for the bradycardia seen in Cushing reflex?

A 56-year-old man with hypertension comes to the physician for a follow-up examination. His blood pressure is 165/92 mm Hg on the left arm and 162/90 mm Hg on the right arm. He reports that he is adherent with his medication and exercise regimen. The physician adds a drug to his antihypertensive medication regimen. This drug increases serum renin, angiotensin I, and angiotensin II levels, and decreases serum aldosterone levels, without affecting bradykinin levels. Which of the following drugs was most likely added to this patient's medication regimen?
A 45-year-old female patient with class II pulmonary hypertension presents with a positive vasoreactivity test. Which of the following is used in the next step of management?

A 5-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department due to recurrent, generalized tonic-clonic seizures over the past 24 hours. He takes no medications and has no family history of epilepsy. The patient's temperature is 39.4°C (103°F), blood pressure is 110/70 mm Hg, pulse is 112/min, and respirations are 10/min. During the examination, the patient suddenly develops sustained, generalized tonic-clonic convulsions without fully regaining consciousness between episodes. Which of the following describes the mechanism of action of the most appropriate initial therapy for his seizures?

options.label: A
options.text: Blockade of presynaptic voltage-gated calcium channels

options.label: B
options.text: Blockade of presynaptic voltage-gated sodium channels

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibition of vesicle fusion and neurotransmitter release

questions.text: True about electroencephalogram (EEG) is all except:

options.label: A
options.text: 10% of the normal population can have epileptiform discharges.

options.label: B
options.text: Scalp EEG may be helpful in localizing frontal lobe epilepsy.

options.label: C
options.text: Doing EEG is not mandatory for the diagnosis of seizures.

options.label: D
options.text: Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy shows triphasic and slow waves.

questions.correct_answer: A. 10% of the normal population can have epileptiform discharges.

questions.text: What is the route of dissemination of the following disease?
Which of the following act via the IP3-DAG Messenger System?

options.label: A
options.text: Angiotensin II on vascular smooth muscle and Vasopressin via V1 receptor on vascular smooth muscle

options.label: B
options.text: Angiotensin Il on vascular smooth muscle and Vasopressin via V2 receptor on epithelial cells

options.label: C
options.text: Angiotensin II on epithelial cells and Vasopressin via V1 receptor on vascular smooth muscle

options.label: D
options.text: Angiotensin II on epithelial cells and Vasopressin via V2 receptor on epithelial cells

questions.correct_answer: A. Angiotensin II on vascular smooth muscle and Vasopressin via V1 receptor on vascular smooth muscle
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Angiotensin II on vascular smooth muscle and Vasopressin via V1 receptor on vascular smooth muscle

questions.text: A 55-year-old man presented with chest pain and shortness of breath. An ECG was taken in the emergency and was shown. What is the likely diagnosis?

Which of the following statements is false regarding the role of urea in renal function?

options.label: A
options.text: A high-protein diet increases the kidneys ability to concentrate urine

options.label: B
options.text: High vasopressin increases the urea deposition in the medullary interstitium

options.label: C
options.text: Urea is transported by urea transport proteins (UT-A) by primary active transport

options.label: D
options.text: Helpful in creation of counter current mechanism

questions.correct_answer: C. Urea is transported by urea transport proteins (UT-A) by primary active transport
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Urea is transported by urea transport proteins (UT-A) by primary active transport

questions.text: Which of the following represents dark stained areas on a karyotype?

A 52-year-old man is brought to the emergency department for recurrent vomiting that began 5 hours ago. He describes the vomitus as bloody and containing black specks. He drinks 10-12 beers daily and has not seen a physician in 15 years. He appears pale. Physical examination shows decreased radial pulses, delayed capillary refill, multiple spider angiomata, and a distended abdomen. He is oriented to person but not to place or time. Which of the following is most likely decreased in this patient in response to his hematemesis?

Oral digoxin is being given to a 65-year-old male as a maintenance dose. A target plasma concentration of 0.70 ng/ mL is decided upon. The digoxin clearance for this particular individual is calculated as 60 mL/min. Knowing that the oral bioavailability of digoxin is 70%, what is the dosing rate in this patient?

A patient has right upper limb BP of 160/85 mmHg and a left upper limb BP of 130/90 mmHg. He also has early diastolic murmur in right 2nd intercostal space. Which of the following is least likely to be associated with these findings?

A 24-year-old G2 at 28 weeks is brought to the emergency after being found unconscious at home by her mother. She is disoriented on arrival and her BP is 180/110 mmHg and 4 + proteinuria. On arrival at the emergency, she has a tonic-clonic seizure which resolves with MgSO4 administration. Once the patient is stabilized, she undergoes caesarean delivery for fetal distress. Post-partum, the below MRI is done. What is the most likely finding on imaging?

A 65-year-old male patient comes to the clinic with unbearable itching while taking a shower which has been present for many months. Physical examination shows the presence of facial plethora. Laboratory examination shows a hemoglobin of 20 g/dL. What would be the best match for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: RBC mass increased, O2 saturation increased, EPO decreased

options.label: B
options.text: RBC mass increased, O2 saturation normal, EPO decreased

options.label: C
options.text: RBC mass increased, O2 saturation increased, EPO normal

options.label: D
options.text: RBC mass normal , O2 saturation normal, EPO increased

questions.correct_answer: B. RBC mass increased, O2 saturation normal, EPO decreased
questions.explanation: Ans. B) RBC mass increased, O2 saturation normal, EPO decreased

questions.text: What would be seen if the central part of the cord was involved? LMN lesion of trunk and UMN of lower limbs. UMN lesion of trunk and LMN of lower limbs. Bladder and bowel involvement. Posterior tract involvement.
A patient with hypercholesterolemia is advised to take colesevelam. What is the mechanism of action of this drug?

options.label: A
options.text: Binding of bile acid in the intestine

options.label: D
options.text: Increased lipolysis of bile acid bound cholesterol

questions.correct_answer: A. Binding of bile acid in the intestine
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Binding of bile acid in the intestine

questions.text: A patient 35-year-old male patient came with sudden onset palpitations. ECG is shown below, with a heart rate of 160 bpm. His BP is 102/78 mmHg. What is the next step in management?

A 40-year-old male presented to OPD with complaints of excessive daytime sleepiness, and his wife also complains that he snores a lot at night during sleep. Which of the following is incorrect regarding his condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased tone of the pharyngeal muscles worsens obstruction

options.label: B
options.text: Fall of oxygen saturation triggers waking episodes at night

options.label: C
options.text: Episodes of apnea increase work of breathing

options.label: D
options.text: PaO2 is normal during the day

questions.correct_answer: A. Increased tone of the pharyngeal muscles worsens obstruction
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Increased tone of the pharyngeal muscles worsens obstruction

questions.text: A 30-year-old patient presents with fever, cough, and tenacious white sputum. Which of the following should be used for treatment?
Match the following:
Which of the following conditions is associated with box car nuclei seen on histopathological examination of the myocytes?
A 68-year-old male admitted to the ICU for acute exacerbation of COPD develops a sudden onset of palpitations. The following ECG changes are seen. His BP is 90/60 mm Hg. What is the next step?
Regarding ABO blood grouping, which statement is false?

options.label: A
options.text: IgM is the most common antibody in ABO

options.label: B
options.text: ABO antibodies are natural and present since birth

options.label: D
options.text: Antibodies are present only if antigens are absent

questions.correct_answer: B. ABO antibodies are natural and present since birth
questions.explanation: Ans. B) ABO antibodies are natural and present since birth

questions.text: A 67-year-old man is evaluated for persistent lower back pain and fatigue. Laboratory testing shows anemia and renal dysfunction. Serum electrophoresis of the serum proteins is shown below. A medication that blocks cellular proteasome action is administered. This treatment is most likely to cause which of the following effects on the abnormal cells?

A sugarcane farmer presents with dyspnea and cough for the last 3 weeks. HRCT shows bilateral ground glass opacities and centrilobular nodules. Lung biopsy shows poorly formed noncaseating granulomas. BAL CD4: CD8 ratio is 2:1. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?
A manufacturer substitutes a drug partly by another drug and doesn’t add it in the label. What is this type of drug called?

Identify the correct statements: Tesamorelin is used in treatment of HIV-associated lipodystrophy Mecasermin is a recombinant form of insulin-like growth factor-1 (IGF-1). Leptin resistance leads to obesity. Oxygen-sensitive potassium (K+) channels are present in peripheral chemoreceptors.
The posture shown in image is seen in :
A 5 year old patient presents to the OPD with dysphagia, dysarthria, and dysphonia. On examination, brisk jaw jerk is seen. What is the possible localisation in this patient?
A 65 year old patient has normal fluency and repetition of speech but impaired naming and comprehension. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 64-year-old man comes to the OPD due to worsening dyspnea on exertion for the past 3 months. The patient has had a nonproductive cough but no chest pain, fever, or chills. He was diagnosed with hypertension several years ago but takes no medications. Physical examination shows bilateral inspiratory crackles as well as dullness to percussion and decreased breath sounds at the right lung base. Chest x-ray reveals a right-sided pleural effusion. Which of the following pleuropulmonary changes are most likely present in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Vascular hydrostatic pressure increased, Oncotic pressure increased, lymphatic flow normal

options.label: B
options.text: Vascular hydrostatic pressure normal, Oncotic pressure normal, lymphatic flow decreased

options.label: C
options.text: Vascular hydrostatic pressure increased, Oncotic pressure normal, lymphatic flow increased

options.label: D
options.text: Vascular hydrostatic pressure normal, Oncotic pressure decreased, lymphatic flow increased

questions.correct_answer: C. Vascular hydrostatic pressure increased, Oncotic pressure normal, lymphatic flow increased
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Vascular hydrostatic pressure increased, Oncotic pressure normal, lymphatic flow increased

questions.text: Which of the following statements accurately describe the effects of Glucose-6-Phosphate Dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency? Decrease in reduced glutathione Decreased NADPH Decreased lipid peroxidation Increased autofluorescence

A 52-year-old male presents with headache, confusion, visual disturbances, nausea, vomiting and seizures. On examination blood pressure is 220/110 mm Hg. Which of the following treatments is most appropriate for managing his condition?

A 30-year-old lady who is 2 weeks postpartum presents with headache, and acute episode of generalized seizures. The contrast-enhanced CT of the head is shown below. What is the drug of choice for the acute management of her condition?
All of the following parameters are true for anemia of chronic disease except:

An 18-year-old man, who was recently started on risperidone therapy for schizophrenia, comes to the office due to involuntary deviation of his head. There is palpable tightening of the right sternocleidomastoid muscle. It is determined that the patient is experiencing a medication-induced dystonic reaction due to motor neuron hyperactivity. The persistent myocyte stimulation causes a substance to be released from the sarcoplasmic reticulum. This substance most likely binds to which of the following proteins to cause this patient's symptoms?

A 40-year-old man presents with abdominal pain, nausea, and dizziness for the past few weeks. His investigations reveal hyponatremia and hyperkalemia. He also complains of skin changes as seen in the image below (A before 3 yrs; B,C,D at presentation). Which of the following is not a feature of this condition?

A 5-year-old boy has developed persistent food-seeking behavior over the past few months. His mother initially thought that the boy was undergoing a growth spurt, but despite how much she fed him he never seemed satisfied. The patient has also started complaining of a headache and nausea in the morning. His physical examination is significant for BMI of 32 kg/m2. This patient's food-seeking behavior could be explained by a lesion causing hyperactivity of which hypothalamic nucleus?

A 60-year-old man presents with complaints of breathlessness on walking a few metres. He adds that he has an uncomfortable awareness of his heartbeat, especially on lying down. Examination reveals widened pulse pressure and pulsating uvula. Which of the following would be the most likely auscultatory finding in this condition?

Two antineoplastic drugs are shown to inhibit intracellular thymidylate formation. The chemotherapeutic effect of drug X can be overcome by Ns-formyl-tetrahydrofolate supplementation, but that of drug Y is not affected. The drugs described in this scenario are most likely which of the following?

Identify the correct statements Capillaries have maximum cross-sectional area. Universal plasma donor is AB negative Calcium carbonate can lead to milk-alkali syndrome Resistant hypertension BP > 140/90 mmHg with two or more anti hypertensives, one being diuretic
A 10-year-old boy presents with the following lesions over his hand, as seen in the image below. Histopathological examination would most likely reveal?

Identify the correct statements Leptin serves a permissive role in puberty Weber-Fechner law describes the relationship between the magnitude of a physical stimulus and the perceived intensity Golgi complex is located in supranuclear cytoplasm in serous acinar cells. Ganglion cells are the third-order neurons in the optic pathway.

A 13-year-old boy collapsed while playing football. ECG showed V5, V6 inversion and prominent inverted T-waves. 2D echocardiography showed the septal anterior motion of mitral valve leaflet. Which of the following features will be seen on clinical examination and which of the following are true regarding the management? Management Beta-blockers are given Beta-blockers are contraindicated ICD is indicated ICD is contraindicated Clinical findings Pulsus bisferiens Pulsus alternans Ejection systolic murmur Murmur increases on standing Murmur decreases on standing

A 63-year-old woman dies of congestive heart failure. Autopsy shows a dilated heart with brownish pigmentation of the myocardium. Light microscopy of her liver after Prussian blue staining is shown in the image below. The patient's brother died of profuse upper gastrointestinal bleeding at age 43. Assuming this patient's disorder is hereditary, which of the following most likely contributed to the delayed onset of her disease compared to her brother?

options.label: C
options.text: Incomplete penetrance of homozygotic HFE mutations

questions.text: What is the correct sequence of cellular events of inflammation? Selectin ICAM-1 CD31 IL-8
